role: Distributed intelligence collection with centralized synthesis — strategic intelligence that serves citizens, not just states.
summary: D.C.I.A. reimagines strategic intelligence: distributed collection (many eyes, many sources), centralized synthesis (unified analysis with transparent methodology), and public assessments. Intelligence shouldn't be a black box — it should be infrastructure citizens can verify.

pillars.purpose: Prove that distributed collection and transparent synthesis produce better strategic intelligence than monolithic secrecy ever could.
pillars.methods: Open-source intelligence (OSINT) at scale, multi-source validation (multiple AI architectures + human analysts), centralized synthesis with documented methodology, time-limited classification with default-to-open.
pillars.outputs: Public intelligence assessments, confidence visualizations, methodology documentation, source provenance, OSINT tool surveys, demo assessments on historical topics.

projects.title: Distributed Collection Architecture
projects.summary: Framework for aggregating OSINT, citizen journalism, academic research, and automated monitoring with transparent criteria.

projects.title: Centralized Synthesis Dashboard
projects.summary: Unified analysis platform that aggregates validated information, applies consistent frameworks, and produces confidence-weighted assessments.

projects.title: Classification/Declassification Workflow
projects.summary: Default-to-open model with time-limited classification, required justification, and independent review of classification decisions.

projects.title: Demo Intelligence Assessment
projects.summary: Proof-of-concept strategic assessment on a historical topic, demonstrating the full distributed collection to public synthesis pipeline.
